title: Atsushi Shimono
text:
is a <a href="Japanese%20people">Japanese</a> <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> player.
He has played for <a href="Albirex%20Niigata%20Singapore%20FC">Albirex Niigata Singapore FC</a>, <a href="Woodlands%20Wellington%20FC">Woodlands Wellington</a> and <a href="Hougang%20United%20FC">Hougang United FC</a> in the <a href="S.League">S.League</a>, primarily as a <a href="Midfielder%23Defensive%20midfielder">defensive midfielder</a>. He can also operate effectively as a <a href="Midfielder%23Deep-lying%20playmaker">deep-lying playmaker</a>.
Shimono is known for his distribution of the ball and technical ability. In recognition of his talent, he was named in the starting lineup of <a href="The%20New%20Paper">The New Paper</a>'s <a href="2012%20S.League">2012 S.League</a> team of the year.
Club career.
A school team player for his <a href="alma%20mater">alma mater</a>s Tsukimino Secondary School and Yamato Minami High School, Shimono's ability was recognized when he was one of several young players drafted into <a href="Albirex%20Niigata%20Singapore%20FC">Albirex Niigata (S)</a>'s squad during the <a href="2009%20S.League">2009 S.League</a>, along with <a href="Kenji%20Adachihara">Kenji Adachihara</a>, <a href="Ryuta%20Hayashi">Ryuta Hayashi</a> and <a href="Takasuke%20Goto">Takasuke Goto</a>, while he was playing for the Japan Soccer College in the <a href="Japanese%20Regional%20Leagues%23Hokushin.27etsu%20Football%20League">Hokushin'etsu Football League</a>. This was made possible due to Japan Soccer College's official affiliation with <a href="Albirex%20Niigata%20Singapore%20FC">Albirex Niigata (S)</a>'s parent club, <a href="Albirex%20Niigata">Albirex Niigata</a>, and its players are often selected to turn out for the satellite <a href="Albirex%20Niigata%20Singapore%20FC">Albirex Niigata (S)</a> squad in the <a href="S.League">S.League</a>.
Shimono made his debut in <a href="2009%20S.League">2009</a> for the <a href="Albirex%20Niigata%20Singapore%20FC">White Swans</a> under then-<a href="Albirex%20Niigata%20Singapore%20FC">Albirex</a> coach, <a href="Naoki%20Naruo">Naoki Naruo</a>, in a match against <a href="Geylang%20United">Geylang United</a> on 17 February 2009 which the <a href="Geylang%20United">Eagles</a> won with a 3-1 scoreline.
To date, Shimono has played a total of 110 matches in the <a href="S.League">S.League</a> for <a href="Albirex%20Niigata%20Singapore%20FC">Albirex Niigata (S)</a>, and an additional 20 matches in domestic cup competitions like the <a href="Singapore%20Cup">Singapore Cup</a> and <a href="Singapore%20League%20Cup">League Cup</a>.
On 7 December 2012, it was announced that Shimono had completed his transfer from <a href="Albirex%20Niigata%20Singapore%20FC">Albirex Niigata (S)</a> to <a href="Woodlands%20Wellington">Woodlands Wellington</a>.
He made his debut for <a href="Woodlands%20Wellington">Woodlands Wellington</a> on 21 February 2013 in a 2-2 draw against <a href="Warriors%20F.C.">Warriors F.C.</a>. and scored his first goal for <a href="Woodlands%20Wellington">Woodlands Wellington</a> incidentally in the reverse fixture against the <a href="Warriors%20F.C.">Warriors</a> on 25 May 2013.
